item.title: Structs vs Classes
item.description: One of the big debates among Swift developers is when to use structs and when to use classes. Classes are the building blocks of object-oriented programming but structs as provided by Swift are newly powerful. Structs have been around in C-based languages for a long time, but Swift has made them more powerful and given them more features so that they are almost indistinguishable from classes. So what are the differences and which one should you use?
